title: This was not what I expected..

comments.comment: The "here's what I expected segment" is really a nice addition to the book review
Book review is honestly one of my favourite series on Felix's channel. This "chill yet intellectual" type of content is frickin amazing. So glad he keeps on doing it :)
Never stop this Pewds. Also, the "what I expect vs reality" segment is a really cool idea going forward.

0:13 I am a Cat by Sōseki Natsume
7:53 Zero to One by Peter Thiel
14:03 The Useful Knots Book
16:30 The Remains of the Day by Kazuo Ishiguro
I'm so glad pewds gets to do whatever he wants and his fan base doesn't mind

14:34 bowline (loop knot)
15:29 clover hitch (hitches)
15:48 square knot (joint knot)
16:17 Figure-8 Knot (stopper knot)

So glad book review is back! Really admire that you read genres/topics that challenge you dont usually gravitate to. When i read im usually a bit apprehensive about whether im going to like a book, but the way you describe how each book, regardless of if you liked or didn't like a book, changes your opinion or original thoughts on something is really admirable.

Whats cool about this content is that my dad actually got into reading random books that has these elements showed by pewds in the video. And i asked my dad why his been doing that recently and he said he watched a video recommended to him by youtube and it turned out to be one of pewds book review which is pretty cool tbh so tnx pewds for giving my dad another thing to be passionate about. 

Also his been calling me more recently just to recommend me a book that he likes and hoped id like it too, so yea i think ill also be reading more often
I love that Felix doesn’t do what people want anymore, he does what he wants to do and I’m living for it lol

I know some people find these vids boring and "not the usual content" for pewds by I highly enjoy them. Its the same with the philosophy videos. Pewds is the person who got me really interested in philosophy and I often go back and watch the philosophy vids he did, I like seeing this side of pewds. I REALLY enjoy all the other content don't get me wrong but these types of videos are still just as entertaining/interesting.

I’ll be honest I really like the direction pewds has been taking his channel. focusing less on what the viewers want and what’s popular and just making videos that are chill and make him happy. I like when he just talks to the viewers about stuff.
It's actually mind blowing how much of a good role model you are. Never stop being you man. Best luck to you.

as a Scout, i can say that the English names for the knots he tied were:
1) Bowline
2) Clove hitch
3) Square knot
I will forever admire the way Pewds’ videos have the most vague titles. Feels like finding s penny on the street every video, and sometimes I get lucky with the philosophical 100 dollar bill videos.
Pewdiepies Viking Nordic ancestors watching him talk about boat knots: Yes my child. You remember the old ways.

14:35 It's called the bowline knot and it goes "the rabbit comes out of the hole, goes around the tree, then back down the hole". That's how I learned it. I agree, Felix. It's a beautiful and very useful knot
I’d prefer him uploading once in a while with content like this (where he’s truly enjoying himself) than having a fixed schedule. Bros love to see a relaxed and cheerful Pewds
I love that Felix acts like a child but honestly is really fúcking smart and has such profound views on shit

I love how mellow the whole vibe is. Just listening to this puts me in a summer evening feeling with my dad. Might be a bit random but pewds would be such a good dad. Educating us on how he looks at things. Reallt happy I grew up with you man

I think i have read about 80% of the books that he's recommended now.
I never thought that pewdiepie would be my all time favorite book rewiever!
The way you initially described “I am a Cat” makes it sound like a Japanese version of Garfield
I’m so happy this came back!  There’s just something really calming about listening to Pewds talk about books. Really happy to see this on my page. Hope you do more if you want to, Pewds!

Booklist: 
I Am a Cat - Soseki Natsume (4/5)
Zero to One - Peter Thiel (2/5)
The Useful Knots Book - Sam Fury (no rating)
The Remains of the Day - Kazuo Ishiguro (3/5)
i honestly love seeing felix do stuff like this because i know it’s something he genuinely enjoys & it makes me happy for him :,
Book! I actually love when people talk about their passions, glad you could come back to do these again

I literally binged your book reviews last night - and now this...
Felix you wonderful man - your book reviews are a special thing!!!

Fun fact about Natsume Sōseki:
He is hugely credited to be the originator of the phrase "The moon is beautiful, isn't it?" (月が綺麗ですね, Tsuki ga kirei desu ne), a more poetic and nuance way of saying "I love you" in japanese. Nowadays, it appears more on pieces of literature like novels and other media more often.
1:32 that “angry Japanese man” (or “Impossibru Guy” lol) is the Japanese comedian Xabungle Kato and that face is actually his signature gag “悔しいです (in English, “I’m frustrated!”)”.
The fact he's learning about knots means he's ready to be a dad

I currently on 3/4 of total pages on “I am a Cat” and i absolutely love how the cat tell us the tale in a satirical manner when he constantly looking down on human lol.
And I recommend the book “Kokoro” also by Soseki Natsume. It’s about a young adult man who explores the meaning of “love” with his done-with-life sensei, and both of them have different view and approach to love. The man’s love is young and untainted, while sensei’s love is distrustful, skeptical, and tainted.
I love that Pewds does whatever kinda video he feels like now. I enjoy seeing him just live his life, enjoying stuff, doing random things, kinda like Jenna Marbles did. Very chill content.
I love the random monologue about knots. You go and tie that knot Felix
That 1st knot in English I think is a bowline the 2nd is definitely a clove hitch the 3rd is a square knot I think.
Imagine how different Youtube would have been if pewdiepie was accepted into art school.

There's this book called 'The Art of Thinking Clearly'. From the title, it clearly implies that this book is supposedly able to help you 'think clearer'. Majority would assume this book would provide ubiquitious tips and guides such as "1. Identifying/Solving Distractions" or whatnot. Frankly, this books talks about biasness our society leans toward, and the common thinking we humans do. It further links down to how these factors play a role in our decision making, irrational or not. After all, there is always a reason to the choices that we make. 10/10 big brain points. Suitable for anyone who likes to know more about how we think, and to people who are struggling because of their choices, such as being doubtful of oneself, or indecisive of everything single, simple thing. But to these people, remember, its all going to be okay. Maybe not, but i hope this book can help anyone in some way :-)

I’m really glad book review wasn’t a one off thing. It’s my favorite series of yours because it’s refreshing to hear someone putting thought and care into reading instead of treating it like an obligation
Love the “what I expected vs what I got” template! Definitely look forward to your book reviews! (:

as a Spanish graduate on Japanese Studies (including Literature), the fact that you mentioned Don Quixote alongside I am a cat made me combust in happiness....... also, the nuances in the way the cat speaks japanese make it funnier in japanese, it is all part of the whole satiric thing that doesn't translate to other languages unfortunately
After seeing the title of the third book, I just imagined Marzia finding everything in the house tied up in knots for weeks afterwards.
God I love those book reviews, the charm is that even tho Felix might be speaking not so fondly about some book he still makes me wanna read it. Truly amazing
I will say as a librarian i really like the structure you used Felix. The this is what I am reading, expecting and what i got. Its a good way to start reflecting on what you read.
I am so glad someone finally talked about Soseki sensei's work. Being his first ever novel, it's crazy how impactful it is.
Felix’s book reviews calm me down so much… I have serious anxiety and I actually don’t know how these videos make me chill.

I watched this video when it first came out and have returned because I finished I Am a Cat. Pewds does a fantastic job sharing this book's strengths. I picked it up at a local Barnes and Noble solely based on his recommendation and I'm so glad that I did. I hope Pewds does more book reviews in the near future.

Hey I know the knots:
14:38 Bowline, useful since it produces a loop that does not change when under tension
15:30 Clove hitch, used everywhere to keep rope under tension, like finishing off lashing
15:50 Reef knot, pewds explains its use :)

These book reviews have been my favorite series through the past few years. Really has made me get back into reading & it’s so cool to hear your thoughts on a book that I just recently purchased (I am a cat) Can’t wait to hear your thoughts on upcoming books!

actually audibly gasped seeing this omfggg. i became a huge fan of your book reviews during your break from them and they seriously got me to start reading again. I've read 6 or 7 books in the last 2 weeks and it's broken me out of my depression a bit. so excited to watch this in the morning
There is something special about Japanese culture that I really connect with... I’ve been plowing through all of Murakami’s books and I just love them. Thanks for the Japan inspiration Pewdz
I could listen to you speak on your intellectual or creative thoughts all day. I love how you read books and educate yourself every day. This is the side of you I like the most.
Never ever stop these reviews pewds, i almost shat myself when i realized this was a book video, like a little came out but i stopped it. Love you

I won’t act like I know that pewds enjoys this, but goddamn. He just looks so happy talking about it. The way he looks when he reaches back in his mind looking like he’s talking about an old memory. Idk. I never look like that anymore it feels like. So it feels great to see someone, who has brought me so much joy over the years, look really happy. Much love. Even if this is cringe D:

Thank you for putting yourself before the consumers, us. To some that's a terrible idea for what an entertainer should be. But being yourself and showing your interests, both physical and verbal is what makes your content so interesting and enjoyable.

Pewds knows quite a great deal about knots. It was interesting attending his lecture, he was very confident and explained it so well

I wonder what more information he is keeping from us

The knots he tied:
1. Bowline
2. Clove Hitch
3. Square Knot
4. Not sure
i am so glad that u read the remains of the day. such a tragic story, a man sacrificed everything for nothing, and realizing he was serving a very evil man
Felix's book review is still such a nice change of pace, knowing the whole time he's been making videos, he's also been reading more than I have. Or you have. Yes you reading this admit it.

I finished "The Stranger" and just started on "Siddhartha" from his other book review. And now we have more! I found The Stranger to be a really weird book that made me feel all types of emotions. Made me doubt what I think is right or wrong. I may pick up another book from one of these!

This is my favourite book review yet. I was very glad that the variety of books you reviewed was more diverse. I really enjoy hearing your perspective on books and it was nice to hear you talk about books that you weren’t even interested in but still read. It seems that you are becoming more precise with the words you use to describe the books as well. Keep doing these!

I almost shed a tear seeing you upload this. As a kid I would watch these and be so in awe of the books and your causal yet detail full reviews. Thank you that I started reading a month back after reminiscing over the old reviews. Hope this isn’t left behind again so I can start reading along. (I’ve been reading Mishimas tetralogy because of your recommendations )
And I’m sure I’m not alone :)

I love cats so much. There are many reasons why i love cats for one they are very cute. They are  extremely fluffy and i desperately and i want to cuddle. They are also very dapper, always looking handsome and classy. It’s not fare for us humans, we will never be as cute or as charming as our dear kitty’s!

I love book review. For the life of me I cant imagine being interested in half of the things Felix gets obsessed with but then hearing his perspective gives me a whole new view on things Ive never considered 10/10

The best book EVER written = "How to win friends & influence people" by Dale carnegie
The best story written about eastern culture by a western author = "Siddhartha" by Herman Hesse
The best book reviewer of all time = "PewDiePie" by Felix Arvid Ulf Kjellberg

I used to have book review in English class which I loved. Your style of reviewing is very similar and it's absolutely brilliant. 

Your own opinion and spin on it is great to listen to.

Thank you.

Here is a man being amazed and fascinated by different types of knots. And surprisingly, it's so interesting to watch.

Keep making videos about things you love and find interesting, pewds... they are always entertaining and fun to watch.
PewDiePie can do anything, from Meme Review to Book Review, no matter what the video will still be entertaining

I love these so much, it's pure quality content.

Maybe I act in a way where analytics think that its not good content, because with any of your book, philosophical etc videos I check if it really is such a video (bc I'm never sure with your thumbnails and titels) and then switch them off again, because usually I want to watch it with my full attention later.
Pewds would love more of these! Like maybe even a second channel dedicated to this. This is seriously great and would love to see it more often.
My fav of your vids has always been just you talking about how you feel about things. So pure I love it!

I love this side of Felix and that he feels
comfortable to share this with us! This shines apart from many other creators related to him!
Btw for all wondering the background music. It’s Dylan Sitts - Chowder
I love seeing the deep and intelligent side of this man just as much, if not more, than his fun and silly side
When u support someone from start and than u see him on this stage. Really feeling proud of u bro ...

A nickname for the first knot is the lifesaving knot. In the US Boy scouts it's told as a rabbit comes out their hole, went around a tree, got scared and went back into the hole.

Second one is called a clove hitch

I recommend the book 'The left hand of darkness' by Ursula K. Le Guinn it's a sci-fi so maybe not what you're looking for at the moment but one I think you might enjoy. It's about an envoy that goes to a winter planet populated by people who do not have a gender except if they mate, then they become a gender (not always the same gender) The book lets you think: what is gender? what are borders? and so on. I really recommend it, I gave it a 19/20. My highest rated book so far.

The list of mentioned books with Felix's ratings
1. "I'm a cat" by Natsume Soseki (4/5)
2. "Zero to one" by Peter Thiel (2/5)
3. "The remains of the day" by Kazuo Ishiguro (3/5)
And "The useful knots" for all of u viking sailors of corse (1000/5)
Honestly, I’m not into books but I love these kinds of videos from him. I feel calm and happy.
I agree with Pewds notion with never let me go, that book is nuts, not nuts bad but it's great . It;s just I feel like the character and it's like torture

I would recommend Ella Minnow Pea by Mark Dunn. As the book goes on the writer uses less and less letters through the writing which culminates in a hard to read chapter using like 5 letters. I will also recommend The Kingkiller Chronicles. The Name of the Wind, the first of the series, is such an incredible book. I've heard it described as an adult Harry Potter. It's got magic. It's got music, its so powerful how he describes the music it's like you can here it. It had a red headed hero named Kvothe. It has sick ass metaphors. It has a medieval-esque kingdom. I genuinely recommend this book any time I can.
i love his book reviews, it's nice to hear his thoughts
